item.title: Why support self-organized learning in the workplace?
item.dc:creator: Learning in the Social Workplace
item.description: I recently shared a diagram of what it might look like to move from a focus on organizing and managing training, to helping individuals and teams self-organize in the workplace? But why would you want to do this, some have asked? Because that is how today’s Smart Workers (SW) prefer to learn. So I’ve now annotated my previous diagram to show how 8 key ways that Smart Workers learn today map onto the diagram. The Smart Worker (SW) learns continuously as she does her job >...

item.title: Taking the reins of professional development — PLP
item.dc:creator: Not So Distant Future
item.description: Too often it seems as educators we find ourselves “at the mercy” of professional development that is last minute, impersonal, and of which we are just passive recipients.
